summary: This is an email sent from an iPhone on March 3, 2021, with the subject line 'No expense spared'. The message contains cryptic text referencing 'Cubanos and fine wine' and 'Flavor of the night', and mentions the sender's daughter commenting on the sender being 'Wdgy enough' for an unspecified 'them' to think the sender 'would play'.

persons.name: Sender (Unnamed)
persons.context: The unnamed author of the email, who references their daughter and makes cryptic statements about being perceived as willing to 'play'.

persons.name: Daughter (Unnamed)
persons.context: The email author's daughter, who is quoted as saying the author was 'Wdgy enough for them to think I would play'.

connections.description: Parent-child relationship, as the sender references a comment made by their daughter.

events.title: Cryptic Email Sent
events.description: An email with the subject 'No expense spared' is sent, containing ambiguous text about 'Cubanos and fine wine', 'Flavor of the night', and a personal comment from the sender's daughter.

keyFacts: The email subject 'No expense spared' and the phrase 'Flavor of the night' suggest discussions of luxury, consumption, or potentially exploitative activities.
The text 'Wdgy enough for them to think I would play' is cryptic and could imply the sender was perceived as willing to participate in questionable activities.
The document is an external email from 2021, indicating post-conviction communications potentially related to the Epstein network.
